content.text:
# Draft:Warshim Chesam

----
| birth_place   = Mayang Imphal Chirai, Imphal West, Manipur, India
| occupation    = Professional bodybuilder, fitness athlete
| years_active  = 2019–present
| known_for     = First athlete from Northeast India to win a silver medal in IBBF
| height        = 5 ft 9 in (175 cm)
| titles        = Mr. Manipur (2021, 2022, 2023); Mr. Imphal East (2022); Mr. Khamba (2022); Mr. Asia Bronze (2023); Mr. India Silver (2024)
}}
Warshim Chesam (born 18 July 2000) is an Indian professional bodybuilder from Manipur. He is known for being the only athlete from Northeast India to win a silver medal at the Indian Body Builders Federation (IBBF) national championship. Chesam is a three-time Mr. Manipur Overall Champion and a bronze medalist at the 55th Asian Bodybuilding & Physique Sports Championship (ABBF 2023). He has represented India at both national and international bodybuilding competitions.
Early life and education
Warshim Chesam was born on 18 July 2000 in Mayang Imphal Chirai, Imphal West, Manipur, to Sirajuddin Chesam and Nureda Chesam. He grew up with two brothers and one sister. Chesam pursued his higher education at Maharaja Bodhchandra College in Imphal.
During his school years, he played football before shifting his interest toward fitness and bodybuilding, eventually pursuing it full-time.
Career
Chesam began bodybuilding during his teenage years and made his competitive debut in 2019 at the Mr. Khorifaba and Mr. Manipur contests, finishing in the top ten in the latter.
Following a break during the COVID-19 pandemic, he returned to the stage and won the Mr. Manipur Overall Champion title in 2021. He went on to win the title again in 2022 and 2023. In 2022, he also won the Mr. Imphal East Overall Champion and Mr. Khamba Overall Champion titles.
In 2023, Chesam represented India at the 55th Asian Bodybuilding & Physique Sports Championship held in Nepal, earning a bronze medal in the men's sports physique category.
He later secured a silver medal at the 1st Mr. India Physique and Sports Championship (IBBF 2024), becoming the first athlete from Northeast India to achieve this distinction.
Personal life
In 2023, while preparing for the Asian Championship, Chesam was involved in a road accident two weeks before the event. He recovered and continued his preparations with the support of his family. He has spoken publicly about the challenges faced by athletes in Manipur and the need for greater institutional support.
Achievements
* Bronze – 55th Asian Bodybuilding & Physique Sports Championship (ABBF 2023)
* Silver – 1st Mr. India Physique & Sports Championship (IBBF 2024)
* Mr. Manipur Overall Champion – 2021, 2022, 2023
* Mr. Imphal East Overall Champion – 2022
* Mr. Khamba Overall Champion – 2022
